file_content.text: Wow, take a look at that. We're going in style now....
Nice ship. Are you leaving Dromund Kaas?
You have something to say about that?
That's right.
On the contrary, I have a going-away present for you.
Who are you?
Relax, I'm a friend... bearing gifts.
You need a lift somewhere?
Want a ride?
No thank you. But I'm glad I caught you before you left.
Cellvanta Grathan sent me to deliver this token of her appreciation. For all you've done for her. It will greatly enhance this new ship of yours.
Tell her I said "thank you."
Much obliged.
I'm afraid I won't be able to do that.
I'm always happy to upgrade my ship.
That will come in handy.
How unfortunate you'll never get in a test flight.
I must have made quite an impression.
She had a good time with me.
So it would seem--on the Lady Grathan, but not on the lord.
You see, Cellvanta's husband, Lord Grathan, has a different present he wants me to deliver. Apparently, he says you know too much.
Does she usually send a Sith to deliver a gift?
A Sith messenger?
Very good. No, that's not the typical MO.
I'm here on behalf of Cellvanta's husband, Lord Grathan, who has added his own present to the offering. He claims you know too much.
So, he seeks to shut me up.
He's afraid I'll talk.
He seeks to slice you up. Shutting you up will just be a beneficial side effect.
Cellvanta needs to get her house in order.
Lady Grathan is slipping.
Are you mad? Lady Grathan doesn't control the household. I answer only to Lord Grathan.
Lord Grathan is dead.
He's not the real Grathan.
Don't waste your last few breaths on idle threats you have no way of carrying out.
I've murdered just about every form of sentient being in the galaxy. And I'm here for you.
Lord Grathan sends me to kill those he deems worthy of an honorable death. So consider this a compliment.
I'm all warm inside.
How nice.
Then it's time to cool you off.
Are you going to talk all day, or what?
Let's just do this.
When I stop talking, you die.
Nice ship. A reward from your cowardly master for killing Lord Grathan's son?
Who wants to know?
You are?
Oh, I already know. I just find it dramatic to ask my prey questions I already know the answer to.
You have a problem with that?
That's right.
That's refreshing. I won't have to beat a confession out of you before I take your life.
A true Sith thanks his foe for providing an outlet for his rage. My master wanted me to thank you before I killed you.
I'll tell him he's welcome the next time I see him.
That's nice of him.
I can neither confirm nor deny those rumors.
None of your business.
So that's the party line, eh?
A true Sith proudly claims his murders. So I will surely stake claim to my murder of you.
A true Sith lets his lightsaber do the talking.
Actions speak louder.
Leave the way you came.
Go away.
Plan on boring me to death?
Yawn.
You have guts, I'll give you that. I'm Lord Grathan's top assassin--he sends me to eliminate those he wants to suffer the most.
I'm here to kill you, friend, for murdering the son of my master.
So what are you waiting for?
Get to it.
In such a rush to die? I'm happy to oblige.
You practice that soliloquy all night long?
Nice speech.
Nice, huh? I wrote it myself.
Time to shut you up.
Too much talk. [Attack]
These are the last words you will ever hear.
